channel.title: Comments on: I Finally Got A Workaround for CorelDRAW’s Most Famous SVG Bug
channel.description: Web Ã— Design; Branditechture is an hybrid creative design agency.

item.title: By: Yusuf Odukoya
item.dc:creator: Yusuf Odukoya
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://branditechture.agency/i-finally-got-a-workaround-for-coreldraws-most-famous-svg-bug/#comment-508">Hudson</a>.
I am very, very glad you found this useful. Thanks for the feedback, bro.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Hudson.

I am very, very glad you found this useful.
Thanks for the feedback, bro.

item.title: By: Hudson
item.dc:creator: Hudson
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://branditechture.agency/i-finally-got-a-workaround-for-coreldraws-most-famous-svg-bug/#comment-506">Yusuf Odukoya</a>.
wow wow chill bro lol some people just like saying dumb things on the internet. Don't worry, it's just a troll. That was a pretty smart catch you just did. I used to open the file on other softwares and just convert it to svg. But using a online converter and making a PDF I've never thought about. Very cool. I've been using corel draw for more than 15 years now and that's a really really annoying problem. Every long time user knows that corel draw its a pretty crapy option to handle "complex vectors" and stuff made on other softwares, and if you trying to do this, be prepared to get frustrated, but I love how fast and simple it is for some simple things like logos and icons. Thanks for the tip!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Yusuf Odukoya.

wow wow chill bro lol some people just like saying dumb things on the internet. Don’t worry, it’s just a troll. That was a pretty smart catch you just did. I used to open the file on other softwares and just convert it to svg. But using a online converter and making a PDF I’ve never thought about. Very cool. I’ve been using corel draw for more than 15 years now and that’s a really really annoying problem. Every long time user knows that corel draw its a pretty crapy option to handle “complex vectors” and stuff made on other softwares, and if you trying to do this, be prepared to get frustrated, but I love how fast and simple it is for some simple things like logos and icons. Thanks for the tip!

item.title: By: Yusuf Odukoya
item.dc:creator: Yusuf Odukoya
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://branditechture.agency/i-finally-got-a-workaround-for-coreldraws-most-famous-svg-bug/#comment-505">Lacy</a>.
I don't quite understand the need for this comment of yours, but this is currently the best and most efficient workaround for the CorelDRAW SVG issue. If you have a quicker method (which I highly doubt you do), then please share. Thanks.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Lacy.

I don’t quite understand the need for this comment of yours, but this is currently the best and most efficient workaround for the CorelDRAW SVG issue. If you have a quicker method (which I highly doubt you do), then please share. Thanks.

item.title: By: Lacy
item.dc:creator: Lacy
item.description: I fail to see how this is less time consuming. also, Corel still has trouble with converting the transparencies and gradients even from other file formats.
item.content:encoded: I fail to see how this is less time consuming. also, Corel still has trouble with converting the transparencies and gradients even from other file formats.
